articles.author: Guy Faulconbridge
articles.description: Vladimir Putin is open to discussing a Ukraine ceasefire deal with Donald Trump but rules out making any major territorial concessions and insists Kyiv abandon ambitions to join NATO, five sources with knowledge of Kremlin thinking told Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Putin, ascendant in Ukraine, eyes contours of a Trump peace deal

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Tanks deepened their incursion and blew up homes, according to residents.
articles.title: Israeli strikes kill 15 in Gaza as hospital in north of the region makes distress call

articles.author: James Pomfret, Jessie Pang
articles.description: Hong Kong pro-democracy tycoon Jimmy Lai on Wednesday testified in court for the first time in his years-long national security legal battle on charges of conspiracy to collude with foreign forces, and publishing seditious materials.
articles.title: Hong Kong pro-democracy tycoon Lai testifies in national security trial

articles.author: Eduardo Baptista, Lisandra Paraguassu
articles.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping's state visit to Brasilia on Wednesday caps a diplomatic blitz across South America that has shown Beijing's growing clout in the region and at global forums where it filled a gap left by the U.S. presidential transition.
articles.title: China's Xi visits Brasilia to cap tour flexing diplomatic clout

articles.author: Lidia Kelly
articles.description: A special hotline in place to deflate crises between the Kremlin and the White House is not currently being used, the Kremlin said on Wednesday, as nuclear risks rise amid the highest tensions between Russia and West in decades.
articles.title: Kremlin says Russia-US hotline to deflate crisis not in use

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Joe Biden has approved providing anti-personnel land mines to Ukraine, a U.S. official told Reuters.
articles.title: Biden approves anti-personnel mines for Ukraine, US official says

articles.author: Francois Murphy
articles.description: Iran has tried in vain to prevent a Western push for a resolution against it at the U.N. nuclear watchdog's board meeting by offering to cap its stock of uranium just shy of weapons grade, the watchdog and diplomats said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Iran offers to cap sensitive uranium stock as IAEA resolution looms

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.S. embassy in Kyiv has received information of a potential significant air attack on Wednesday and will be closed, the U.S. Department of State Consular Affairs said in a statement.
articles.title: US embassy in Kyiv shuts down over anticipated air attack

articles.author: Lucinda Elliott
articles.description: Uruguayan center-left opposition leader Yamandu Orsi, whose political ambitions were galvanized by his experience growing up in a dictatorship, is the pollsters' narrow favorite to win the second round of the South American nation's presidential election on Sunday.
articles.title: Uruguay election frontrunner Yamandu Orsi pledges a 'modern left'

articles.author: Charlotte Greenfield, Gloria Dickie
articles.description: Plagued by drought and deadly floods, Afghanistan has been unable to access UN climate funds due to political and procedural issues since the Taliban came to power.
articles.title: Exclusive: UN moves to unlock stuck climate financing for Afghanistan
